intro: Oreocharis maximowiczii var. mollis, commonly known as the soft-leaved oreocharis, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family, and is characterized by its delicate, grass-like foliage. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in loose inflorescences, typical of many orchid species. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
